^^ it is working but youll need to uninstall the bluesoil as you cant have 2 bluetooth managers and also turn off all bluetooth devices when installing and note that there may not be drivers for your perticular phone etc, this is a manager not a driver pack

Thank you so much thethingy for this upload! Struggled with the Broadcom (widcomm) installer program - wouldn't detect my dongle. But this installed and worked a treat - I used the 32 bit installer on XP Home SP2.
Word of advice though, Remote Procedure Call Locator service needs to be loaded to connect to other devices.. but that'll only matter if you've streamlined your services and switched it off in the first place :-)
Much, much appreciated, thanks.

Worked on an ASUS i5 laptop under W7 x64, although windows tried its best to install while the Toshiba s/w was running.

Once the drivers were installed and the logitech BT M555B mouse was found, the latest x64 SetPoint (6.2) app s/w from logitech worked just fine.
